sections.description: This section describes our used color paletts.
If you need a shade of grey, choose one of the following

modifiers.name: @gallery
modifiers.description: Very light grey - used for background of pages and selected element in sidebar navigation.

modifiers.name: @silver
modifiers.description: Light grey - used for borders e.g: document boxes, tables

modifiers.name: @manatee
modifiers.description: Grey - used for hovering borders, disabled buttons or navigation elements.

modifiers.name: @dove-gray
modifiers.description: Dark grey - used as border color for textinput.

modifiers.name: @mid-gray
modifiers.description: Dark dark grey - used as floating label color and placeholder.

modifiers.name: @ship-gray
modifiers.description: Dark dark dark grey - general text color on document boxes, buttons, links, navigation, subnavigation things which can be hovered in general.

sections.description: These are the main color variables. Use those variables instead of using CSS HEX values.

modifiers.name: @tangerine
modifiers.description: Primar Color

modifiers.name: @azure
modifiers.description: Secondary color - not used a lot at the moment.

modifiers.name: @red
modifiers.description: This is red - used for warnings in forms and notifications.

modifiers.name: @black
modifiers.description: Black

modifiers.name: @white
modifiers.description: White

sections.description: This section describes the fonts and icons we are using. Headline and basic layout like paragraphs, basic list and so on are explained as well.
We use Lato with font weight 300 as out main font, as backup sans serif fonts. The code is from here: https://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/using-font-face/
sections.markup:
We are using Lato with weight 300!
This is strong.
This is italic.
sections.wrappedMarkup:
We are using Lato with weight 300!
This is strong.
This is italic.

sections.description: We use the headlines defined in Bootstrap.
For Icons we user Font Awesome in general. For the name of icons have a look at the cheatcheet.

sections.description: This section describes base elements like navigation, buttons, form elements and so on.

modifiers.name: @lh
modifiers.description: Vertical Gap (top to bottom) - Line Height, using the one from bootstrap, it is about 20px. Is is like a vertical grid.

modifiers.name: @gap-h
modifiers.description: Horizontal Gap (left to right) - Using the one from bootstrap, it is 12px. It is used for horizontal gaps.

sections.description:
This section descibes the overall grid. We use the Bootstrap 12 column grid. It is a fluid full-width layout using .container-fluid. Have a at the bootstrap documentation about grid.

We do not optimize for mobile yet so we are only using col-md-x. Columns need to be placed in .row elements. Placing .rows inside columns results in remove the left an rigth padding, which is sometimes not needed.
For the left main navigation the bootstrap .nav-pills .nav-stacked are used.

  • element with icon
  • element

sections.description: This is a normal navigation from bootstrap using only the nav element, with a dropdown menu, which can have some very complicated content! (CSS is coming from hell!) It contains a list with two lines and icons and some color beeing right aligned.
